page.title: 01BLOCK REVIEW, HOCKLIFFE
page.content: This{rural}area includes{two hillsite} {villages,}overlooking the surrounding pastoral and arable area, dotted with {farmsteads;}and drained by{Clipstone } {Brook.}The population, below a thousand, has remained almost static since the last century. Near{Hockliffe {church}is land of{archaeological interest; an{earthwork}and a{deserted {village,}neither of which have been fully excavated. Although{Tebworth}has a church, it is placed a mile off in a field, not in our area. Towards {Tebworth}the{topography}of the land becomes hilly. The residents of both villages are mostly employed in nearby towns e.g.{Luton,}and some work as far afield as{London. Tertiary}employment plays a{major}part in the village occupations.{Our survey includes {studies of buildings, customs, roads, {changes and occupations.}
